title: File import callback not supported appears in Etherscan Verify & Publish

body:
Hey @zeevtur, what's the process you're using to verify on Etherscan? Are you doing it manually? Or using a plugin like [truffle-plugin-verify](https://github.com/rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify)? If you're using truffle-plugin-verify, could you also say what version of that package you're using?

I'm also a bit curious why the error message indicates `https://` paths for your import statements (Truffle does not support that), but looks like your Solidity example doesn't use that form, so I'm not sure what the disconnect is.

It might be worth noting that the latest openzeppelin-contracts is v3.3.0, which is a full major version what you're using. Might be worth trying to update?

Thanks for opening this issue! Any additional info would help us figure out what's going wrong. Cheers!
Hi @zeevtur we're closing this for issue maintenance. If you have any new information or need additional help with this please let us know!

Ok. Thanks

On Wed, 13 Jan 2021, 20:08 Faina Shalts, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi @zeevtur <https://github.com/zeevtur> we're closing this for issue
> maintenance. If you have any new information or need additional help with
> this please let us know!
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/3579#issuecomment-759656876>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIM7XHSVYBXRAGBDKKS5HHDSZXVTDANCNFSM4UMLQFYQ>
> .
>

> Compiling .\contracts\cert.sol

/C/Users/punya/InnovFin Certificate/contracts/cert.sol:5:1: ParserError: Source "/C/Users/punya/InnovFin Certificate/node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/ownership/Ownable.sol" not found: File import callback not supported
import "../node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/ownership/Ownable.sol";
^---------------------------------------------------------------------^
,/C/Users/punya/InnovFin Certificate/contracts/cert.sol:6:1: ParserError: Source "/C/Users/punya/InnovFin Certificate/node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721Full.sol" not found: File import callback not supported
import "../node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721Full.sol";
^---------------------------------------------------------------------------^

Compilation failed. See above.
Truffle v5.2.6 (core: 5.2.6)
Node v14.16.0 

Could I get help for this?
Same issue. This needs to be resolved.

I'm seeing this issue as well.

```
ParserError: Source "@openzeppelin/contracts@4.1.0/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol" not found: File import callback not supported
 --> myc:4:1:
  |
4 | import "@openzeppelin/contracts@4.1.0/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol"
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

ParserError: Source "@openzeppelin/contracts@4.1.0/access/Ownable.sol" not found: File import callback not supported
 --> myc:5:1:
  |
5 | import "@openzeppelin/contracts@4.1.0/access/Ownable.sol"
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Same issues here.

Developer on macos says it works for him (I think he's using an older version of truffle).

I'm on Linux.  Tried node 12.22, 16.2, and 16.3 packages to no avail.

Truffle 5.3.9.

EDIT: Incrementally downgraded all the back back to 5.2.6 (core 5.2.6), and same error.

If you selected "Compiler Type: SINGLE FILE / CONCATENATED METHOD", then you have to do just that–concatenate the file. Replace every import statement with the full contents of the imported file. Recursively replace every input statement in _those_ files with the file contents as well, until there are no import statements left. This worked for me.

Same problem here (in my case with Remix and etherscan. I can't verified the contract )

 myc:4:1: ParserError: Source "https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v3.4.0-solc-0.7/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol" not found: File import callback not supported
import "https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v3.4.0-solc-0.7/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol"
^-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------^

Hi @harshitsinghai77 @nicoarkano @lucasuema @PunyajaMish @Maraboue can someone write up a new issue with steps to reproduce? I have not been able to reproduce this on the newest Truffle and its hard to track this/respond to it because you are commenting on a closed issue. We'd love to dive deeper into this as a new issue. Thanks so much!

Hey @fainashalts 

For me, the problem was the wrong import. Most of the people are following some tutorial or blog, where they're importing it as
`import "openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/ownership/Ownable.sol";`

and hence the `File import callback not supported` error.

I explored the code a bit and found the wrong import. The correct way to import in `"version": "4.3.2"` is
```import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";```

PS: after importing if you get 
```
Error: Truffle is currently using solc ^0.8.0, but one or more of your contracts specify "pragma solidity >0.4.23 <0.7.0".
```

Then try this
```
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";
```

and go to `truffle-config.js` and change `solc` version
```
// Configure your compilers
  compilers: {
    solc: {
      version: "^0.8.0", // Fetch exact version from solc-bin (default: truffle's version)
    },
  },
```

Hope it helps.
